attributes.action: Make malicious, false reports or allegations to authorities a criminal offence.
attributes.background: At the moment a report or allegation which has been made maliciously with intent to harm is treated as a civil matter. The Data Protection Act allows people to make false reports wasting time and resources whilst protecting their identity. This should be treated as a criminal offence and punishable.
attributes.additional_details:
There is nothing civil about making a report to authorities about someone that is based on lies, malice and with intent to harm the accused.

Currently malicious reports are treated as a civil matter and police do not get involved. These reports can cause distress and for the person accused. The Data Protection Act protects the rights of the reporter even when a report has been investigated and proven to be malicious and false. These people get away with wasting public funds, resources.

attributes.action: The Government make immediate preparations and employ more border personnel
attributes.background: That the Government must not delay any longer and must immediately hire more personnel, for customs and border security and be ready for brexit in March 2019. We were promised contol of our borders yet so far we have not seen evidence that any preparation has been made

attributes.action: Put the university fee down to £6000. Not fair on students too much burden.
attributes.background: Once the students have achieved their target they start working. It's really hard for students to work, study, they pay for traveling, food and accommodation. Once they start work it's not fair on them to pay back loan with interest. If the fee goes down to £6000 it makes it little easier.

attributes.action: Establish baseline health monitoring for communities less than 3km from fracking
attributes.background:
Public Health England state about fracking:

'Baseline environmental monitoring is needed to facilitate the assessment of the impact of shale gas extraction on the environment and public health.'

Baseline health monitoring is equally essential to protect community health. Yet absent.
attributes.additional_details:
What is a health baseline?
It measures existing illness and potential future illness. Your current baseline has been shaped by your medical, social and family history and is constantly being influenced by your environment. 
Fracking has proven risk factors. 

Respiratory issues: https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamainternalmedicine/fullarticle/2534153

Pregnancy issues:
http://advances.sciencemag.org/content/3/12/e1603021

Other:
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0048969716325724

attributes.action: Start dredging rivers regularly in the help of flood prevention.
attributes.background: Cumbria has suffered many bad floods over the last 13 years and it's time something was done. Flood defences only slow down the water but actually clearing the rivers of silt and debris would be more effective. Also allowing farmers to manage rivers flowing through their land.

attributes.action: Inquiries into rape, abuse and systematic grooming of children be independent
attributes.background: For at least forty five years, in many of our cities and towns, rape and sexual abuse of children has been ongoing and systematic. Regular reports have been made to all official capacities in those places without effect or action taken by them. It is not felt internal inquiry would be efficacious
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to the inquiry committee being fully independent, the panel should comprise of at least four of the affected parents from each city and town and in a fully paid participant capacity for the duration of the inquiry.

That those parents be rotated each week and afforded FULL police security before, during and after inquiries as necessary.

That employers consider any time away from jobs in the same way as Jury Duty

attributes.action: Train fare increases should be frozen or capped at 1%
attributes.background: As a long suffering commuter I'm sick of paying out substantially increased fares each year with little noticeable improvement to services. Trains constantly break down, are over-crowded, or the issue is with Network Rail (meaning they get massively compensated but pay back very little to us)

attributes.action: Increase Police Funding & the Number of Police Community Support Officers.
attributes.background: There has been a noticeable increase in crime across the UK particularly in knife, domestic burglary & vehicle-related crimes. It is apparent that the police force do not have the required resource to effectively tackle and resolve these increasing issues. We as UK citizens feel unsafe & uneasy.
attributes.additional_details: Between September 2016 and September 2017 the recorded crime rose across the UK by nearly 15%, with a rise of 21% in knife crime, a massive 32% rise in domestic burglary and an 18% increase in vehicle-related crimes. National police officer numbers have fallen to the lowest level in more than three decades. The statistics clearly show that the rise in crime in recent years is a national problem that requires national solutions.  It is a proven fact that police presence reduces crime.

attributes.action: Split Leeds and Bradford City Councils into smaller district councils.
attributes.background: Leeds & Bradford City Councils are too large to focus of individual communities. On greenbelt protection, providing cheaper housing on brownfield sites, transport & modernising infrastructure, local people's views are often ignored. Smaller councils would be accountable to more localised voters.
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds & Bradford City Councils planned too much housing for greenbelt sites & failed to act sufficiently on local views. This would have defeated the objectives of greenbelt by merging communities with urban sprawl & destroying their historical character. Leeds' revised plans still have greenbelt in reserve for development as "Broad Locations".

An Act of Parliament could restore councils which existed before 1974, such as Aireborough, Horsforth, Keighley, Morley, Pudsey, Shipley & Wharfedale.

attributes.action: Change the law to recognise Domestic Abuse as a crime in its own right
attributes.background: Currently if a victim goes to the police to report Domestic Abuse it will often be classed as Common Assualt which has to be reported within 6 months or action cannot be taken. Many victims do not have the confidence or courage to come forward within the timescale required by law.
attributes.additional_details: The laws relating to domestic abuse are outdated. Many victims do not have the confidence to talk about their abuse for many years and when they find the courage to speak out and report the crime they find that the law only allows them 6 months to report it. Quite often the abuser will go on to assualt another victim. It is time that domestic abuse was recognised as a crime in its own right and the timescale changed to help the frightened and sometimes terrified victims.

attributes.action: Expel Israeli Ambassador, after attacks on the State of Palestine.
attributes.background: Demonstrations by Palestinians against Trump's declaration of Jerusalem as capital of Israel were met with violence by Israeli soldiers who shot and killed demonstrators and arrested children.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding Parental Responsibility
attributes.background: When family member such as grandparent, aunt, uncle etc is bringing up a family member such as grandchild, nephew, niece etc, unless it would harm the child to do so such family members to be automatically granted Parental Responsibility.
attributes.additional_details: Tens of thousands of grandparents bringing up grandchildren in the absence of one or both parents cannot get Parental Responsibility without a tedious, expensive and often contentious court process. This applies even in cirumstances where the mother is deceased, the father shown not to be the biological father by DNA testing and not playing any part in bringing up the child concerned. Unless it would harm child to do so, Grandparents to be automatically given Parental Responsibility.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law regarding council tax
attributes.background:
Parliament to change the law, so that local councils can't increase council tax by more than inflation. 
Most people in the UK do not get a wage increase more than the rate of inflation and therefore can't afford a council tax rise of 5%.

attributes.action: Residents of Thanet to engage with the Secretary of State and Thanet District Co
attributes.background: To enable the residents of Thanet to engage with the Secretary of State and Thanet District Council, to make clear their views on the objectives for the proposed Thanet plan.
attributes.additional_details:
Thanet District Council at a meeting the other week rejected the Local Plan .
So the Secretary of State said he will be getting involved. 
We the Residents would like to put our views over to the Secretary of State and our reservation on the numbers talked about

attributes.action: Reject plans to build a massive solar farm on Graveney Marshes in Kent.
attributes.background: Plans are being prepared by developers to build the largest solar farm in the UK on Graveney Marshes adjacent to a SSSI, nature reserve and the Saxon Shore Way. The proposal envisages unsightly 4 metre high solar panels on hundreds of acres of land which would ruin this idyllic area of coastal Kent.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is opposed by the local MP, Helen Whateley as well as Kent Wildlife Trust, the RSPB and the Council for the Protection of Rural England. Local residents are also totally opposed.

As a major national infrastructure project because of its' size, any formal planning application will have to be decided by the Secretary of State.

attributes.action: Mandate to install standard microfiber filters in washing machines
attributes.background: Around 700,000 microscopic fibres could be released into waste water during each use of a domestic washing machine.These microfibres act as sponges to toxic chemicals known to cause cancer etc. They end up in Fish/ Sea Salt/Tap&Bottled water where they release these chemicals & may become lethal
attributes.additional_details:
The current filters in the washing machines are not capable enough to filter these microfibers and this leak can be stopped, if we mandate installation of standard microfiber filters

1. The Hidden Plastic In Our Dinner: http://bit.ly/2FeK5YJ 
2. https://www.plymouth.ac.uk/news/washing-clothes-releases-thousands-of-microplastic-particles-into-environment-study-shows
3. https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/28/stella-mccartney-calls-for-overhaul-of-incredibly-wasteful-fashion-industry
4. http://www.thethamesproject.org/dangers-microfibres-microplastics/

attributes.action: Increase the defence budget and take the money from foreign aid.
attributes.background: The uk government spends £14 billion a year on foreign aid to nuclear capable nations such as India and Pakistan now it is clear they do not need it and so by giving the military that money they could invest in new ships, tanks and planes and stop the hollowing out of our once proud armed forces.

attributes.action: Bring the Bayeux Tapestry to Hastings (or Battle).
attributes.background: It's great President Macron has agreed to loan the Bayeux Tapestry to the UK. It should be displayed in Hastings (or Battle), home of the historic battleground. It would also be a huge boost for the area's tourism.

attributes.action: Allow adult British citizens the right to choose doctor-assisted suicide
attributes.background: Adults should have the right to choose authorised-doctor-assisted suicide in Britain, protected by legal safeguards established in consultation with interested parties, including mental health professionals and disability organisations.
attributes.additional_details: The legal rights to make end of life choices, such as putting a Do Not Attempt Resuscitation order in a Living Will, and to dignity already exist. Assisted suicide is legal in 5 European countries, Canada and several states in America. It is available to British citizens who are able to travel to the Swiss clinic Dignitas and are capable of receiving, and can afford to pay for, its services. It is not currently legal in Britain.

attributes.action: Make gcse exams free for all children under 18, including home educated children
attributes.background: Currently, parents/carers of home educated children must pay around £200 per GCSE subject that their child wishes to sit exams for (including exam board and exam centre fees). This actively discriminates against home educated children and should be funded by the government.
attributes.additional_details: Children and parents sometimes choose home education due to disabilities or vulnerability (for example, due to psychological issues caused by bullying brought about as a result of the main stream schooling system). As well as discriminating against home education, forcing parents/carers to pay for gcse exams out of their own pocket may result in gcse qualifications becoming less accessible to vulnerable children. This also risks certain disabled children starting life with fewer qualifications.

attributes.action: Ban Standing Charges on all Energy and Water Bills
attributes.background:
Standing Charges on Gas, Electricity and Water, bills are an unfair charge, and have no real basis on the amount of Energy or water used.
The standing charge is just another way for the Energy and Water Companies to unjustly increase their profits.
attributes.additional_details:
SSE charge £24.53 plus 5% VAT =  £26.98 on both Gas and Electricity,
For a dual fuel set up that adds £53.98 per quarter to the consumers bill, absolutely no real justification for this type of rip off.

attributes.action: Allow the new GCSE students to have a formula sheet in Maths and Science exams.
attributes.background: It is unfair that we have to memorise all the formulas. It makes the exam 10 times harder and puts stress on the students as they need to memorise every single formula that could potentially come up on the exam.

attributes.action: Ban the use of glitter and save our marine life!
attributes.background:
Tops Day Nurseries have made a pledge to become more sustainable and have recently discovered an unexpected item that has already had a detrimental effect on the environment… Glitter. 

Although much loved as an art and craft favourite, glitter is a microplastic, just like microbeads.
attributes.additional_details:
We already know that 100% of mussels found off France and Belgium have ingested microplastics and many fish have too; so if you eat shell fish you more than likely have eaten microplastics too, along with the toxic additives that manufacturers use which are known to copy oestrogen, and affect human fertility. 

As responsible people looking after the next generation, the last thing we want to do is damaging the environment or risking their health, so we need to act now and stop this pollution.

attributes.action: Outdoor nature-based learning to be compulsory and weekly in all English schools
attributes.background: We believe that not enough children of all ages are being exposed to weekly outdoor sessions in all seasons and all weathers, connecting with nature and involved with sustainability, knowing practical ways to care and protect the world they live in
attributes.additional_details: This campaign is led by a forest school leader.

attributes.action: Fund PTSD recovery centres for ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel
attributes.background:
Thousands of ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel have been diagnosed with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and depression.
This trauma causes flashbacks, nightmares, anger and depression - often leading to violence, alcohol and substance abuse, job loss, family breakdown and suicide.
attributes.additional_details: We aim to set up a number of PTSD “Front line” recovery centres around the country offering horticultural and other therapeutic treatments specifically aimed at helping to re-habilitate ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel and help them to come to terms with their illness and move on. We plan to arrange a meeting with members of the government and opposition parties to obtain cross party support for this project and ask for £6 million to help fund its start up.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions for epipens free to anaphylaxis sufferers on the NHS
attributes.background: Vital life-saving drugs qualify for free prescriptions on the NHS, such as those that treat diabetes. Anaphylaxis sufferers have to carry an epipen throughout their life. This is undoubtedly a life-saving medication and should qualify to be on the exemption certificate for free prescriptions.

attributes.action: Commit to a long-term funding plan for health & social care to the year 2035.
attributes.background: We are calling on the government to recognise the rising demand, underfunding and workforce crisis in the NHS and social care sector by committing to a long-term funding plan for health and social care to the year 2035.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is supported by the NHS Confederation.

attributes.action: Stop shops opening on boxing day
attributes.background: Please give retail workers an extra day off to spend with their families

attributes.action: Lyme's Disease treatment, support and awareness!
attributes.background: Lyme disease and its co-infections get more difficult to treat the longer it is left. Early detection is essential for the right course of antibiotics for the right amount of time. This disease is often misdiagnosed as other diseases such as: MS, ME, Fibromyalgia and many more.
attributes.additional_details: We need an awareness campaign and funding for more research and support services for sufferers. Most people don't know about Lyme and most Lyme sufferers don't know they have it. It can ruin and also take lives. My mum has lived with Lyme for 8 years and her health is declining due to no support or treatment, other than what is available privately which many of us can’t afford.  Why should people suffer in silence with no support? Everyone supports cancer, why can’t we support all diseases?

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the decision to incentivise diesel cars & its effects
attributes.background: In 2001 the government decided to link car tax (VED) to CO2 emissions. In 2002 company car tax also became emissions-based. People were encouraged by such incentives to buy diesel cars. Health-damaging air pollution has worsened dramatically and diesel car owners now face punitive charges.
attributes.additional_details:
Two very serious effects of this decision fully justify a public inquiry, to ensure such grave policy mistakes aren't repeated and to consider public compensation:

1. Air pollution now causes 40,000 early deaths in the UK and costs the country £27.5bn a year, according to the government's own estimates. MPs have called this a "public health emergency".

2. People encouraged to buy diesel cars now face punitive costs and barriers to their use. This reversal is grievous public maladministration.

attributes.action: Offer Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe diplomatic protection and secure her release.
attributes.background: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has been imprisoned unjustly in Iran and her case has been set back by Michael Gove and Boris Johnson’s failure to be clear about her motive for travel. She should be offered diplomatic protection and brought back to the UK, with her child Gabriella, as quickly as possible.

attributes.action: The Government should ensure women are fully represented across the curriculum.
attributes.background: In the centenary year since the passing of Representation of People Act which enabled women over 30 with property to vote, it seems fitting that the women’s struggle for equality and equity should be featured across the curriculum as should women’s achievements which are under represented

attributes.action: Force the chewing gum industry to pay for gum clean up costs - not the taxpayer
attributes.background: Local councils/taxpayers waste over £1million A WEEK to scrape chewing gum off our streets. The government must hold billionaire gum producers accountable for the huge costs their products inflict, and legally force them to pay for the clean up costs. Currently, they pay nothing towards these costs.
attributes.additional_details:
Local councils have faced 32% cuts in their budgets since 2010.  It's estimated that 2,000,000 blotches of gum are dropped on pavements every week in the UK, costing £1.50 to remove each black/white coloured blotch of gum.

A gum tax needs to be imposed on the sector to help offset the unsustainable and obscene costs that local Councils are currently having to bear - and which diverts scarce funding away from social care, housing and other essential local services.

attributes.action: Make not keeping receipts/basic accounts when you hold an LPA a criminal offence
attributes.background: Now, if you're entrusted with a vulnerable persons finances, a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) it is only suggested that you keep receipts/records/basic accounts to explain any purchases made. It should be a legal requirement to produce this if requested to help safeguard our vulnerable loved ones.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my father, Richard Nelson Scott, on 17/5/16. No one thinks that a family member will steal from their vulnerable, ill loved one but it happened to us. It's happening more now with our ageing population. Some get away with it by having an LPA. By amending current guidelines the LPA holder will have to produce records if a concerned person wants an investigation of financial affairs.

attributes.action: Means test Prisoners to pay for their care in Prison.
attributes.background: There are Prisoners who have personal assets i.e. properties and bank accounts that should be used to pay for their care, just as those within society have to pay for their care in old age

attributes.action: Revoke journalist Lauren Southern's ban from the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern is a right-wing Canadian journalist who has been banned from entering the UK by the UK Home Office. 
Whilst she does hold views that are deemed controversial, the decision to ban her is unprincipled, immoral, and an anti-productive way to go about dismantling racism.
attributes.additional_details:
Lauren Southern is a Canadian born journalist who rose to fame online when she held up a sign explaining why she does not identify as a feminist. 
Since that photograph, she went on to work for the right-wing media outlet 'Rebel Media', which she has since left to pursue a career as an independent journalist/YouTube personality.

attributes.action: Allow builders to remove fixed materials if work is unpaid
attributes.background: Many builders are working for the private sector and when final payment is due many clients don’t pay due to the law being on there side not allowing the removal of any unpaid fixed materials, we would like the law changed to allow us to remove any unpaid fixed materials to recover the costs

attributes.action: Adopt into UK law all anti-abuse measures of EU Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive.
attributes.background: Tax avoidance is widely accepted to be legal but both immoral and anti-social. As the EU’s anti tax avoidance directive can be universally accepted as a good thing and has not been a factor in public debate concerning the UK’s EU membership, the UK should opt in to the directive and implement fully.

attributes.action: Make part time schooling (flexischooling) a legal right for families.
attributes.background: Flexischooling is currently legal at the discretion of the head teacher, but many are too afraid of damaging their attendance statistics to agree. I call on the government to make flexischooling a legal right for all children.

attributes.action: Make computer science controlled assessments (NEA'S) mandatory for the GCSE.
attributes.background: On Monday 27th November, news broke that Ofqual may be scrapping the coding element of some GCSE exams due to fairness of controlled assessments, and the breaking of rules. However this is ridiculous. How could you learn food technology without actually cooking, or physical education without sport.
attributes.additional_details: This proposal is to ensure that the examinations are going to stay reasonable, as in an ever increasing technological world, Britain's next generation could have a massive skills gap that increases. We would like to cement programming as a legal requirement for GCSE's to ensure positive outcomes.

attributes.action:
Abolish 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid spending
Spend OUR money at home
attributes.background:
The budget for Foreign Aid spending has increased to £14bn.
We believe that it is wrong that our own Government spends our taxes abroad when our NHS is in crisis and police budgets are under pressure. 
It is time to Stop the Foreign Aid Madness and spend OUR money at home on NHS and our police.

attributes.action: CARIBBEAN DAY is recognized as AUGUST 1st
attributes.background: The UK Caribbean community in several areas including politics, entertainment and sports is an integral part of a socially integrated modern Britain.  This petition seeks that Parliament pronounce  recognition that AUGUST 1st is a date of culture significance for the UK Caribbean community.
attributes.additional_details: The Caribbean and its descendents have been part of Britain’s fortune for centuries. The wealth generated from the colonies provided national means prior to the Industrial Revolution; In the First World War the West Indies Regiment comprised of Caribbean volunteers joined with Britain in time of war and the Caribbean community was present again for WW2, and after Caribbean immigrants answered the call to rebuild Britain’s labour, health and transportation services economy.  A day of remembrance.

attributes.action: Work with the devolved Governments to build a bridge between Scotland and NI.
attributes.background:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-glasgow-west-42772343

"Prof Alan Dunlop thinks the "Celtic bridge" would cost about £15bn, a fraction of the estimate of £120bn for the English Channel bridge."

"He said it would boost both economies and help the post-Brexit border issue."
attributes.additional_details:
"The business potential is exceptional, the chance of actually really making an investment in what would be the true north."

"We share a lot of history together, similar ideals."

"It would send out a dramatic marker in aspiration for the country going into the 21st Century."

"We do have incredibly talented architects and engineers in Scotland so I am sure that as a technical challenge it wouldn't be insurmountable."

Work with NI Assembly and Scottish Government to build a bridge

attributes.action: The NHS should give boys the HPV vaccine to prevent cancers later in life.
attributes.background: Boys will suffer from HPV related cancers later in life just as girls will if they aren’t given the HPV vaccine. Currently it is said to be cheaper to treat the cancers than to provide the vaccine. These are some of the few preventable cancers; lets act on this one!

attributes.action: Have a second referendum on leaving the EU
attributes.background: When the people voted to leave the EU on 26th June 2016 there was no proper debate or understanding about the implications of a decision to leave, either by the people or the government. Now the issues are clearer it is a moral and political duty to put it to the people again.
attributes.additional_details: The 2016 referendum appears to have been initiated in order to try and unite the Tory party. The issue of whether we are in the EU or not is so important it must be above party politics. Brexit must only be implemented after a fully informed electorate have been given the opportunity to confirm this is their choice.

attributes.action: Compensatory marks for the Spelling Test of the GPS SATS test KS2 for Dyslexics
attributes.background: Profoundly dyslexic pupils who dont have any other concurring learning difficulty other than their dyslexia need to be given compensatory marks for spelling.It is proven that they cant hear sounds therefore cant distinguish them and therefore wont spell correctly, equal to that of hearing impairment
attributes.additional_details: Dyslexic pupils are expected to achieve 88% on the Grammar Test whilst their average non dyslexic pupils are expected to achieve 66%  to be at National. Non dyslexic pupils can achieve up to 20 marks for spelling whilst dyslexic pupils are discriminated against due to their disability.Pupils report at national standard or not, based on 3 elements of grammar, punctuation & Spelling. Without compensatory marks dyslexic pupils have to achieve 20% higher on G&P in order to be at expected standard

attributes.action: RAF should provide cover for Air cadet squadrons if CO is unfit for duty
attributes.background: Our squadron (2391 parkstone) has been temporarily suspended due to our CO being unfit for duty. At our squadron, the suspension is affecting us deeply. We believe that we should get to run temporarily with all members of staff (e.g. warrant officer) whilst waiting for a replacement.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords/agents to discriminate against you for having pets
attributes.background:
Too many animals are put up for adoption because the landlord, letting agent and property managers won’t allow them in the homes they are letting.  
A sensible solution would be that tenants have to pay a ‘pet deposit’ which would cover any damages caused by animals living in the home.

attributes.action: Ban the use of domestic Wood Burning Stoves to improve air quality for all
attributes.background: Wood burning stoves are becoming more and more common which is evidenced by the tangible and demonstrable drop in air quality in recent years. You do not need any scientific equipment to witness the drop in quality. Just step outside on any cold day or night and you will smell the foul acrid smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Breathing clean, unpolluted, fresh smelling air should be a basic human right, but yet in modern Britain it is not as people are permitted to set fire to wood in order to create heat, which is completely unnecessary in 2018. Household wood burners should be banned immediately before more people are duped into buying them under the green banner and releasing more harmful particulates into the air. It is a shame to think that breathing clean fresh crisp winter air is currently a thing of the past.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for criminals carrying out vehicle theft
attributes.background:
I recently went through the emotional torture of having my home broken into, my personal belongings rummaged through all in order to steal my 4 week old car from my driveway.
To say I'm heartbroken would be an understatement and anyone that has been through similar would understand these feelings.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the past 3 years, vehicle theft has increased by over 30%!! 40 police forces within England and Wales reported over 85,000 cases last year alone meaning the true figure is tremendously higher.
There is a lot of money in vehicle theft and with the sentence currently standing at 12 months (if charged as High Culpability), you can understand why its on the increase as the criminals feel untouchable

We demand that Vehicle Theft Criminals MUST face far tougher sentences
